title: IT Manager
description:
**Yogurtland  
Hiring: IT Manager  
Pay: $120,000/yr.  
Shift: ****Monday through Friday days, some nights and weekends.  
Location: Dallas, TX (Hybrid Role)**

As a company **IT Manager** you will manage (plan, organize, lead and control)
a team of IT resources (database/BI lead, web application analyst, and, end-
user support analyst), outsourced vendor services (SaaS application vendors,
application partners, systems and network engineering), and, design, develop,
implement and operate systems interfaces that integrate disparate platforms
for franchise management, accounting, supply chain, and Point of Sale (POS).

The **IT Manager** will oversee staff in the day-to-day performance of their
jobs, providing direction and prioritization of activities based on business
need. Ensures that projects are planned and tracked toward meeting their
milestones and adhering to approved budgets. The **IT Manager** will be the
point of escalation for resolving end-user problems, and, will provide the
documentation and training needed to empower the user to be more tech savvy
and independent.

The **IT Manager** will position themselves as a trusted advisor to the
functional and departmental leadership team and management, earning their
trust through effective communications and follow through. They will analyze
existing operating procedures and determine development and quality
improvement plans. They will manage supplier contracts, maintenance agreements
and upgrades, managing IT expenses and contributing to the annual budgeting
process.

CULTURAL QUALIFICATIONS

In everything the Project Manager does, he or she needs to be:

        * THTK - Totally Honest, Totally Kind
        * Humble - modest, respectful and open
        * Heart & Soul - passionate and totally committed
        * Team Play - selfless and team first
        * Imaginative - innovative, bold and whimsical

 **Responsibilities:**

        * Lead and manage the IT and store support teams, promoting a culture of collaboration and continuous improvement.
        * Mentor and develop IT staff, focusing on skills related to both technical support and customer service.
        * Conduct regular team meetings and performance evaluations.
        * Develop IT strategies that align with overall business objectives, with a particular focus on enhancing store-level operations.
        * Plan and oversee the implementation of new IT systems and upgrades, ensuring minimal disruption to store operations.
        * Ensure the continuous operation of IT systems across all stores, with particular attention to POS systems, network infrastructure, and other critical store-level technologies.
        * Oversee the installation, configuration, and maintenance of hardware and software in stores, ensuring all components are functioning optimally.
        * Provide specialized support for POS systems, ensuring all transactional and operational functionalities meet store requirements.
        * Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to POS systems promptly to minimize downtime and customer inconvenience.
        * Implement and monitor security measures to protect store and customer data, with a strong focus on POS system security and PCI compliance.
        * Conduct regular security audits and updates to safeguard against threats.
        * Manage contracts and relationships with technology providers, ensuring they deliver value and meet the needs of each store.
        * Develop and manage budgets for store IT needs, including POS systems, ensuring cost-effective allocation of resources.
        * Manage IT projects with an emphasis on store integration and support, ensuring smooth rollouts and minimal impact on daily operations.
        * Oversee the integration of POS systems with other business systems, ensuring seamless data flow and functionality across store operations.

 **Requirements:**

        * BS in Computer Science (or software engineering) required
        * 5+ years of technical experience
        * 3+ years supervisory experience
        * 5+ years of store systems experience (Micros POS, Clover/Bypass POS)
        * 5+ years of supply chain systems and technology
        * 3+ years of experience w/PCI DSS requirements and solutions.
        * Must have strong QA experience.

 **Benefits:**

        * Medical, Dental, Vision
        * Paid Time Off
        * 401k

Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Software Engineering Manager
description:
**COMPANY:** HealthMark Group is a leading provider of healthcare release of
information solutions, dedicated to simplifying and streamlining the exchange
of medical data between healthcare providers, payers, and patients. We empower
healthcare organizations to securely and efficiently manage the exchange of
health information, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements while
maintaining the highest standards of privacy and security.

 ****

**LOCATION: DALLAS, TX, Fully remote**

 ****

**POSITION: SOFTWARE ENGINEERING MANAGER**

 ****

Are you a first-class developer and mentor? Do you want to build state-of-the-
art new software solutions? Do you hold yourself and others to high standards?
HealthMark Group might have the perfect job for you.

We are looking for a Software Engineering Manager who has a track record of
leading, designing and developing complex web and data applications. As a key
member of HealthMark's software engineering team you will be managing
development teams and be the lead technical expert for a product line. You
will serve as a technical leader, able to discuss data structures, new
technologies, and new methods of achieving system goals. You will also provide
servant leadership to your team, removing roadblocks, coaching and mentoring
as needed, facilitating collaboration with internal customers, and helping
your team to succeed.

The Software Engineer Manager must be able to prioritize well, communicate
clearly, have a consistent track record of delivery, excellent software
engineering, and excellent mentoring skills. Creative engineering balanced
with high quality and a team focus. Must be able to work across multiple
facets of the project and juggle multiple responsibilities at the same time.
Strong analytic capability, the ability to design innovative solutions, and a
penchant for creative problem solving. We are looking for highly motivated
individuals who are looking to grow their career in a fast-paced environment.

HealthMark Group is building the next generation of software for digital
health information, including patient engagement and patient records. We focus
on reducing the overall administrative burden of healthcare patient data
journeys **.**

 ****

**PRIMARY ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

 ****

        * Managing and leading a software development team(s) ****
        * Recruit, hire, mentor, and coach software engineers at different levels of experience
        * Manage and support the software development lifecycle of new and existing web and data applications in collaboration with Product teams
        * Maintaining and drive enhancing a CI/CD DevOps pipeline to include and improve source code versioning, automated testing (unit and functional), and automated deployments
        * Drive application security improvement through security reviews, static and dynamic code analysis, and security scanning.
        * Ensure engineering best practices like code reviews, pairing, refactoring, and automated unit testing practices are in place and improve code quality
        * Contribute to system architecture, research new technologies
        * Support Development teams in designing loosely coupled, highly cohesive software components following SOLID software design principles
        * Be a persistent, creative problem solver
        * Own all operational metrics and production support for your teams' software
        * Maintaining an eye towards security, scalability, performance, and maintainability
        * Participating in a mostly remote results driven working environment
        * Designing intuitive and easy to use user interfaces

 ****

**REQUIRED EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS:**

 ****

        * 8+ years of professional software development experience in a Microsoft stack
          * SQL Server tables and stored procedures
          * C# MVC and APIs
          * .NET Core
        * Experience mentoring young software developers
        * Experience building complex web and data systems that have been successfully delivered to end users
        * Excellent troubleshooting and communication skills
        * Strong understanding of design and architectural patterns
        * Understanding fundamental design principles of a scalable application
        * Proficient understanding of code versioning and CI/CD tools
        * Proficient understanding of developing software in the cloud (preferably in AWS)
        * Experience with managing Agile software development teams (Scrum and/or SAFe)
        * BS/BA in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or related field
        * Results Oriented

 **ADDITIONAL PREFFERED EXPERIENCE** :

        * Azure DevOps including YAML
        * AWS Certifications
        * Agile Certifications
        * Html5/Angular
        * Healthcare Industry/FHIR

title: Software Engineer
description:
Company Description  
  

Blend is a dynamic and innovative technology company at the cutting edge of
data analytics, digital marketing, and AI solutions. Known for delivering
outstanding results for our Fortune 500 clients, we combine state-of-the-art
analytics, data expertise, and technology with digital marketing prowess. As
we continue to expand at an unprecedented rate, we are looking for a Software
Engineer specializing in Omni Analytics Behavioral Data Instrumentation to
join our team in San Bruno, CA.

Job Description  
  

As a Software Engineer for Omni Analytics Behavioral Data Instrumentation at
Blend, you will play a pivotal role in developing and maintaining our advanced
web and mobile applications. Your expertise will drive the implementation of
behavioral data tagging, playing a critical role in our eCommerce platforms.

 **What You Will Be Doing:**

          * Spearheading the development and maintenance of sophisticated web and mobile applications.
          * Implementing innovative behavioral data tagging across eCommerce platforms.
          * Collaborating in an agile team environment to drive data instrumentation solutions.
          * Ensuring the integrity and accuracy of data through quality assurance.
          * Analyzing data with non-SQL Enterprise BI tools and SQL-based frameworks.
          * Offering strategic guidance and insights to cross-functional teams.
Qualifications  
  

 **Required Skills:**

          * Proficiency in Vanilla JavaScript (ES6, ES2016+), HTML5, CSS3, React, Redux for web development.
          * Expertise in Kotlin & Android Studio or Swift & XCode for mobile app development.
          * Experience with Charles Proxy and non-SQL Enterprise BI tools.
          * A minimum of 3 years in a role focusing on web and mobile application development in a large-scale environment.

 **Nice to Have Skills:**

          * Experience in developing JavaScript libraries/frameworks.
          * Strong knowledge in SQL & Database Management.
          * Demonstrated ability in cross-functional collaboration and innovation.

 **Education:**

          * A degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field is preferred.

 **ETC:**

          * Exceptional communication, organization, and teamwork skills are essential.
  
  
Additional Information  
  

 **Additional Information**

This full-time role is based in Dallas, TX or San Bruno, CA and requires an
onsite presence. The project duration is 12-13 months, starting as soon as
possible and concluding by April 30, 2025. Competitive salary of up to $75 per
hour and benefits package offered, commensurate with experience and skills.

 **Diversity and Inclusion**

At Blend, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. We
believe that a diverse team is key to our innovation and success, and we are
dedicated to fostering an environment where all team members are valued,
respected, and have opportunities for growth and success.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**Senior Software Engineering Manager**

 **Location:** Various Locations Available  
 **Department:** Information Technology  
 **Reports to:** Chief Information Officer (CIO)

 **Supervises** : Business Analyst  
 **FLSA Status:** Exempt

 **About Fitness Connection:**  
At Fitness Connection, we champion the cause of health and vitality by
providing accessible and high-quality fitness experiences to everyone. With
over 40 locations, we're dedicated to transforming communities through
fitness, driven by our EPIC core values of Excellence, Passion, Integrity, and
Connection. Our commitment extends to creating a digital space that
complements our physical presence, enhancing our members' journey towards a
healthier lifestyle.

 **Position Summary:**  
We are seeking a visionary Senior Software Engineering Manager with a knack
for leadership and a passion for crafting exceptional web, eCommerce, and
mobile experiences. As the driving force behind our digital evolution, you
will lead the development of high-impact projects that cater to our growing
community of fitness enthusiasts. This role is unique; it requires a leader
who is equally comfortable coding as they are managing projects and teams,
including third-party vendors. You'll be at the forefront of developing
innovative features such as gamification, rewards systems, and a seamless user
experience, drawing inspiration from customer-centric brands like Dave and
Buster's, Top Golf, Wingstop, Pizza Hut, etc.

 **Why we need you!:**

        * You will lead the effort to redesign our mobile app from the ground up with a focus on frictionless customer experience and self-service capabilities;
        * Help us define the technical architecture roadmap and lead the implementation as we continue our digital transformation journey;
        * Identify & explore opportunities business to leverage AI strategically across the business to streamline workflows and improve employee effectiveness.

 **Key Responsibilities:**

        * Lead and execute web, eCommerce, and mobile development projects, ensuring they align with our strategic vision and meet critical deadlines.
        * Hands-on development, including coding, to drive project completion and address any technical challenges.
        * Manage and collaborate with third-party vendors for ongoing projects, ensuring their integration and enhancement of existing systems.
        * Drive innovation by implementing features like gamification, points/rewards systems, and enhanced user experiences, drawing on high volume membership and billing platform expertise.
        * Foster a culture of excellence, agility, and innovation within the team, promoting our EPIC core values.
        *  **Quality Assurance Expertise:** Seeking a proficient tester with a comprehensive understanding of software testing methodologies, including unit, integration, and automated testing, to ensure the delivery of high-quality code.

**Must-Have Attributes:**

        1.  **Proven Leadership:** Demonstrated experience in leading software development projects with a focus on web, eCommerce, and mobile platforms. A track record of successful project delivery, embodying our leadership and management principles.
        2.  **Technical Expertise:** Hands-on coding skills and a thorough understanding of modern development practices and technologies.
        3.  **Innovative Thinking:** A creative approach to problem-solving, with experience in developing features that engage and retain customers, akin to the experiences provided by brands like Dave and Buster's and Top Golf.

 **Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:**

        * Expertise in React Native, Node.js, TypeScript, HTML, CSS, and cloud computing platforms.
        * Experience with payment processing APIs, ensuring secure coding practices in a PCI-compliant environment.
        * Demonstrated ability to lead and inspire a team, fostering an environment of growth and innovation.
        * o React Native, Node JS, TypeScript, HTML, CSS

o AWS serverless computing including Lambda, API Gateway, and DynamoDB

o Google Analytics, Tag Manager, Webflow CMS, SEO, Zoho PageSense, Sanity

o Azure Logic Apps, Azure Functions, Webhooks, Graph API

o iOS & Android application development

**Education and Experience:**

        * Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
        * 7+ years of IT experience, with at least 5 years in hands-on software development and project management in the tech industry. Experience in the fitness, restaurant, or retail industry is a plus, especially with subscription-based products.

**Why Join Fitness Connection?**

        * Impact the lives of thousands by enhancing their fitness journey through technology.
        * Work in a dynamic environment that encourages innovation and growth.
        * Enjoy competitive compensation, benefits, and a culture that values work-life balance.

**Fitness Connection is an Equal Opportunity Employer,** committed to building
a diverse and inclusive team.

Job Title: Sr. Software Engineer  
Location: Ft Worth, Texas (50% on-site role)  
Job Description:  
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Sr. Software Engineer to join
our team and design, develop, implement, document, and support various
internally developed Train Control Systems, including Positive Train Control
(PTC), Train Sheets, and various supporting .NET applications/services, with a
focus on Safety and High Availability. The ideal candidate will use technology
systems/applications development experience to analyze requirements, evaluate
design alternatives, and develop software solutions that meet business
objectives.  
Key Responsibilities:  

        * Design, develop, implement, document, and support various internally developed Train Control Systems
        * Use technology systems/applications development experience to analyze requirements, evaluate design alternatives, and develop software solutions that meet business objectives
        * The applications developed will primarily use the .Net framework, the C# language, ASP.NET, Geographic Information System (GIS) and SQL Server databases in implementing Microsoft based software systems for an intranet web environment
        * Key responsibilities will be the architecture and design of applications for a safety-sensitive environment
        * Work with business customers for requirements gathering and system analysis
        * Responsible for design, implementation, and all phases of testing
        * Ensure best practices are followed in implementing technical solutions
Basic Qualifications:  

        * B.S. degree in a technical or Engineering field or at least 6 years of equivalent business experience/ equivalent formal training
        * At least 6 years of Object Oriented Development experience
        * 5+ years of proven hands-on experience developing distributed systems based using C# to develop .Net Framework based desktop client applications and highly available Windows Services
        * 5+ years of SQL Server
        * Extensive web API and microservice development, integration and orchestration
        * Experienced at unit, integration, system level testing and troubleshooting issues across platforms
        * Able to identify underlying problems and appropriate techniques for solving them
        * Excellent verbal and written communication skills
        * Excellent organizational skills
        * Solid analytical and problem-solving skills
        * Must be a team player who shares knowledge
        * Able to work in high performing teams and deliver under pressure situations
Highly Qualified Candidates Will Have:  

        * 10 years of Object Oriented Development experience
        * Experience in safety critical product development (e.g. rail, medical, aerospace...)
        * Experience with Web Forms ASP.NET, JavaScript, CSS, HTML
        * Experience with GIS
If you're a team player with a passion for technology and a desire to work
with a growing company, we encourage you to apply for this exciting
opportunity.  
  

Flexible work from home options available.

title: MEP Engineer/Plumbing
description:
Compensation: Based on background, experience, and comprehensive benefits
package.

 **Plumbing/MEP Engineer Position Description**

Overview:

The Plumbing/MEP Engineer will be responsible for designing, developing, and
overseeing the installation of plumbing systems. This role also requires the
engineer to leverage their technical expertise and market knowledge to
identify new opportunities, and maintain relationships with clients,
contractors, and suppliers.

 **Responsibilities:**

Design and oversee the installation of plumbing systems, ensuring compliance
with all local, state, and federal regulations.

Prepare detailed drawings, specifications, and cost estimates for all plumbing
installations.

Coordinate with architects, builders, and other engineers to integrate
plumbing systems into overall building design.

Conduct site inspections to ensure adherence to plans, specifications, and
quality standards.

Provide technical support and troubleshooting during construction and
commissioning phases.

Stay updated with the latest industry trends, technologies, and best practices
in plumbing engineering.

Identify, assess, and pursue new project opportunities that align with the
company's capabilities and growth objectives.

Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, contractors, suppliers,
and other stakeholders to ensure repeat business and referrals.

Represent the company at industry events, conferences, and professional
associations to enhance its visibility and network.

Collaborate with the marketing team to develop promotional materials, case
studies, and proposals that highlight the company's MEP engineering expertise.

Provide input on market trends, customer needs, and competitive positioning to
inform the company's service offerings and strategies.

  

 **Qualifications:**

        * Experience in Mechanical Engineering, Plumbing Engineering, Civil Engineering, or a related field a necessity.
        * Professional Engineer (PE) license a plus.
        * Minimum of 3 years of experience in plumbing, with a proven track record in plumbing design and installation.
        * Ability to read and understand blueprints.
        * Strong understanding of business principles and experience in business development within the construction or engineering sectors.
        * Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
        * Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities in a fast-paced environment.
        * Proficient in MEP design software (e.g., AutoCAD, Revit MEP) and Microsoft Office Suite.

title: Lead Software Engineer
description:
**Lead Software Engineer**

About Systemates Inc.

From our corporate offices in DFW, Systemates is not-so-quietly plotting the
construction industry on a course to a more tech-focused future. Our award-
winning software, Projectmates, contains all of the functionality needed to
unite and streamline complex construction project management processes. Put
simply, Projectmates users are more efficient, more cost-effective, and better
prepared for the changing construction landscape.

Now, this is where you come in.

We're searching for people who thrive in a small, growth-focused environment.
You need to be passionate about helping customers solve problems and focused
on self-improvement. Our talented and diverse team is working to take
Systemates to the next level.

Help us build something great.

 **About the Job:**

This role will directly lead a team of Senior Developers and the development
of the Projectmates Software. You will be responsible for handling updates,
code reviews, deployments, bug fixes, high-level customer requests and the
day-to-day tasks of the developers. The ideal candidate will be a hands-on
Software Developer with expert technical and leadership abilities. This
position will report directly to the CTO.

 **What You 'll Be Doing:**

        * Meet business needs by managing the activities of a team of developers to ensure consistent delivery or quality solutions in a timely manner
        * Oversee the programming, integration, and testing of software systems, working closely with cross functional teams both onshore and offshore
        * Ensure the developers are completing projects on time and remain actively involved in continuous improvement of the products
        * Actively participate in code reviews with an eye towards best practices and software craftsmanship
        * Examine the current application design, and work with business and technical staff to recommend solutions that result in more effective systems
        * Investigate problem areas and improve system quality by identifying issues and common patterns and developing standard operating procedures
        * Test software systems to diagnose and resolve system faults
        * Assist in the development of new user-facing features
        * Perform other duties and/or special projects as assigned

 **Desired Skills & Experience:**

        * 3 or more years' experience as a Team Lead or Senior Developer
        * 5 or more years' experience in business application development
        * Expert-level knowledge of:
        * Microsoft .NET technology stack (C# / .NET Core, ASP.NET, Azure, SQL Server, ReactJS, JavaScript, Azure DevOps)
        * Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science, information systems or computer engineering
        * Displays innovation and expects the same from their team.
        * Self-motivated, team player, strong communicator

 **Where you 'll be working:**

This is a hybrid full-time role based out of our Richardson, TX office.
Monday-Thursday will be spent in-office and Friday is a work-from-home day.

 **EEO Statement:**

Systemates Inc. is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to
be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive
consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender,
gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics,
disability, age, or veteran status.

title: Software Developer (Hybrid role)
description:
Description:

 _First things first …_

Are you ready to illuminate your career with a dynamic and innovative team?
Heads Up Technologies is seeking a **Software Engineer** as part of our
Engineering Team within the Software Development Group. The Software Engineer
will be responsible for designing and implementing properly documented,
reliable software that ensures safe and proper execution of microprocessor
and/or DSP-based electronic products/systems.

  

 _Key Details:_

* Work Days and Hours: Our normal working hours for Engineering are 8:00 am-4:00 pm Monday-Friday including a one-hour lunch. Employees are encouraged to use "flex" hours (i.e. arrive between 6:00 and 9:00 am) to accommodate traffic.

* Location: This is an onsite position located in Addison, TX.

*Description:

 _First things first …_

will be responsible for designing and implementing properly documented,
reliable software that ensures safe and proper execution of microprocessor

* Compensation: Based on background, experience, and comprehensive benefits package.

  

 _What we do:_

At Heads Up Technologies, it has been our privilege to work with some of the
most respected names in the aerospace, aviation, and entertainment industries.
While our customers vary widely in size, market, and geographic location, they
all come to Heads Up for the same reason: Heads Up's commitment to delivering

The company is well-positioned for continued growth and expansion and has

 **Job Responsibilities**

* Software design and development of microprocessor and/or DSP-based electronic products and systems.

* Working with engineering prototypes and production designs from concept through manufacturing release.

* Participate in hardware/software integration of multiple system components.

* Take software lead on specific projects following department processes and standards and ensure the design functionally meets customer requirements.

* Participate in R&D and new product design efforts.

 **Required Qualifications**

* Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering (BSCS, BSEE) or equivalent.

* Five (5) - ten (10) years of software design experience.

* Must be familiar/experienced with the C programming language in Embedded Systems/Real-Time OS/Windows OS.

* Experience and an understanding of software design, and test/verification techniques, including system integration (hardware/software/mechanical) of multiple components. 

* Experience with Ethernet and microprocessor / DSP-based products including concept, design, testing, verification, integration, documentation, etc.

* Logical thought processes, excellent attention to detail, and ability to conceptualize, implement, and document innovative solutions.

* Ability to read and understand schematics and datasheets.

* Strong problem-solving skills relating to software design. 

* Requires little supervision, go-getter, ability to learn on your own and seek out new responsibilities.

* Positive interpersonal skills in dealing with co-workers.

  

 **Desired Qualifications**

* Experience with diagnostic tools (oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, spectrum analyzers, etc.). 

* Experience with HTML/CSS/JS and/or Front-End GUI Design. 

* Experience with one or more Real-Time Operating Systems. 

* Familiarity with GIT/CVS or other code archiving tools.

* Experience with Assembly languages.

* Experience with Linux OS tools, Bash scripts.

* Familiarity with DO-178C.

* Familiarity with FAA and/or Mil Spec requirements.

  

 _Perks and Benefits_

* A competitive compensation package, including medical, dental, and vision coverage.

* Opportunities to plan for the future with our 401(k) program.

* Paid Time Off - Take the well-deserved time off you need.

* Life Insurance - Enjoy the peace of mind that comes with life insurance coverage.

* Health and wellness benefits including Health Savings Account (HSA) option.

* Opportunities for professional growth and development within the company.

* Positive and inclusive work culture.

  

 _Why Us?_

At Heads Up Technologies, you have the opportunity and support to reach for
the sky collaborating internally and with partners to deliver artistry in
engineering.

  

Every position in our company has its unique responsibilities, but they all
require the same traits: motivated, self-starter, creative, enthusiastic and
dependable. A team player that has respect for the opinions and input of
others. Performance- and process-driven. Someone who gives 110% at work, but
still seeks balance by making time with family and hobbies a priority.

  

Did this post spark something in you? If so, we're looking forward to
reviewing your resume.

  

No recruiting agencies.

Requirements:

  

 **Tentamus North America** , is seeking a strong **Software Developer** to
assist with the development of our internal laboratory IMS (LIMS).

 **Main responsibilities:**

        * Developing applications, scripts and modules for our LIMS (laboratory information management system) in cooperation with internal lab customers.
        * Supporting laboratory software solutions, optimization of software and processes in the laboratory environment, adaptations according to own and external requirements.
        * Advising colleagues in the laboratory as well as support for technical problems with hardware and software - in cooperation with IT department.
        * Creating and updating documentation and process descriptions.
        * Work with the Development team on projects for labs in the U.S. and globally.

 **Qualifications:**

        * Associates or Bachelors' degree in business or information technology or comparable training
        * 6+ years development experience preferred
        * Relevant programming skills in languages: JAVA, React, Groovy, HTML, XML, SQL and Crystal Reports are desirable
        * Knowledgeable with REST/SOAP API's
        * Professional experience in project management
        * Knowledge in requirements analysis, customizing and programming, testing and ticketing systems are an advantage
        * Dynamic, assertive, creative and organized individual
        * Economic and entrepreneurial thinking skills
        * Ability to work from home 2 days per week and able to commute to our lab in Grand Prairie, TX

 **What we offer you:**

        * Competitive salary
        * Comprehensive and low-cost benefits package
        * 401k with 3% match
        * Industry stability with global presence
        * Company that is growing
        * Challenging tasks, a motivated team and a long-term perspective
        * A family-conscious working environment

 ** _Labs for Life_**. We are a global network of full-service accredited
analytical laboratories providing crucial quality and safety analysis for
clients locally, nationally, and beyond using proven methods of chemistry and
microbiology. Many of the products you use and consume daily rely on Tentamus
labs. With 18 labs in the U.S. and growing (100 globally), we celebrate having
the most talented diverse scientific and service-oriented professionals in the
industry.

title: Field Service Engineer
description:
**Position Overview:**

As a Field Service Engineer, you will play a key role in providing technical
support, maintenance, and repair services to our customers in the field. You
will work directly with clients to troubleshoot equipment issues, perform
routine maintenance tasks, and ensure optimal performance of our products.
This position requires strong technical skills, excellent customer service
abilities, and the flexibility to travel to customer sites as needed.

 **Responsibilities:**

          * Respond promptly to customer service requests and inquiries, both remotely and on-site, to diagnose and resolve equipment malfunctions and technical issues.
          * Install, configure, and commission new equipment at customer locations, ensuring proper setup and functionality according to specifications.
          * Perform routine preventive maintenance and inspections on equipment to identify potential issues and minimize downtime.
          * Conduct thorough troubleshooting and diagnostic tests using specialized tools and diagnostic software to isolate and repair faults in equipment.
          * Collaborate closely with internal teams, including engineering, sales, and customer support, to address customer needs and provide timely solutions.
          * Document all service activities, including equipment installations, repairs, and maintenance tasks, using electronic service reports and documentation systems.
          * Provide training and technical support to customers and end-users on equipment operation, maintenance procedures, and troubleshooting techniques.
          * Adhere to company policies, procedures, and safety guidelines while performing service activities in the field.
          * Maintain accurate records of parts inventory, service tickets, and customer communication to support efficient service operations.

 **Qualifications:**

          * High school diploma or equivalent; Associate's degree or technical certification in a related field preferred.
          * Proven experience in a technical field service role, preferably in the [Insert Industry] sector.
          * Strong mechanical, electrical, and troubleshooting skills with the ability to interpret schematics, diagrams, and technical documentation.
          * Proficiency in using hand and power tools, multimeters, oscilloscopes, and other diagnostic equipment.
          * Excellent customer service and communication skills, with the ability to interact professionally with clients and internal stakeholders.
          * Flexibility to work independently and travel to customer sites, sometimes on short notice and for extended periods.
          * Valid driver's license and clean driving record.
          * Ability to lift and carry heavy equipment, climb ladders, and work in various environmental conditions.
          * Willingness to participate in ongoing training and professional development to stay current with industry trends and technologies.

 **Benefits:**

          * Competitive salary
          * Health, dental, and vision insurance
          * Company vehicle and travel reimbursement
          * Retirement savings plan
          * Paid time off and holidays
          * Opportunities for career advancement and growth

title: Software Engineer, PLC, SCADA, WinCC OA  Dallas (SW1836)
description:
**Software Engineer, PLC, SCADA,WinCC OA Dallas**

  

Our mid-size client firm, a leader in its industry, is hiring a Software
Engineer to work on software solutions for large-scale automated assembly. The
primary focus is control system configuration and development, including
microprocessor-based servo motion control, heating applications, analog and
digital sensors, network communication, and graphical user interfaces.
Opportunity for a project engineering role, initially or in the future. This
entails overseeing, leading, and managing the project.

  

 **Why should you apply here?**

        * Successful 25+ year old firm
        * Large domestic and global clients
        * Factory automation, Robotics, Device Control Systems
        * Staff of 25 Engineers in the business unit, 16 Software Engineers
        * Employee high retention rate
        * No-cost medical insurance for employee and family coverage

  

 **What will you be doing?**

        * Work on projects throughout the full SCLC, including specification, design, programming, implementation, integration, commissioning, and debugging
        * Work in a structured coding environment and participate in projects that involve software and hardware
        * Program in Siemens Scripting or Allen Bradley Scripting
        * Work on cross-functional teams with mechanical/electrical design, project management, and manufacturing
        * Opportunity for a project engineering role, initially or in the future. Entails overseeing leading, and managing the project
        * Works directly with customer to troubleshoot and solve critical problems within the automation system
        * Presents information and interfaces with customers and leadership
        * Develops and executes functional software test plans to validate project requirements
        * Travel to customer sites

  

 **What are the minimum qualifications?**

        * Bachelor of Science in Electrical, Computer Engineering, Mechanical, Mathematics, etc.
        * 3+ years of experience
        * Experience programming in one of the following:
        * Siemens Scripting/Siemens PLC programming (TIA-Step 7) or equivalent, WinCC Advanced, WinCC OA, WinCC Flex, ** _OR_**
        * Allen Bradley Scripting, Allen Bradley Studio 5000, FactoryTalk View ME
        * Must be able to travel 35% of the time, primarily domestically, with potential for international travel
        * Excellent oral and written communication skills are a must

  

 **What will make your rsum stand out?**

        * Experience in factory automation or control systems
        * Self-starter, able to work independently, act and deliver results, and exercise a high level of judgment
        * Project leadership/management skills

  

 **Location:** 100% on-site. Headquarters in Dallas, TX.

  

 **Relocation:** Assistance offered.

  

 **Citizenship:** U.S. Citizens. If necessary, you may need to get DOD
security clearance.

  

 **Salary:** 80k 115k, Paid Overtime (10k - 20k), 401k matching is 6%.
Fullypaid medicalinsurance for employees and dependents.
